page.title: 19Cheriton Bishop Biographies
page.content: The 4 women volunteers who compiled this survey are all active middle-aged members of Cheriton Bishop Women's Institute, and between them they have 10 grown-up children; 7 boys and 3 girls. All the children have had to leave home because of lack of employment opportunities in the area. None of us has a paid full-time job; 3 drive cars. The most popular hobby is gardening, followed by reading, writing, entertaining, sewing, knitting, spinning and wine-making. Other pastimes include theatre-going, eating out in local pubs, day outings and holidays both at home and abroad, genealogy, singins, walking and researching local history. Nancie Grist, Marjorie Sharland, Rita Steadman and Hazel Wilson.
